meanings.definition: The arrangement of similar parts or structures in a linear series.
meanings.sent1: The homotaxis of the leaves on the branch made them look like a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study homotaxis to understand how organisms develop and grow.
meanings.sent3: The homotaxis of the books on the shelf created a neat and organized look.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the homotaxis of the flowers resembled a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The artist used homotaxis in the painting to create a sense of harmony and order.

meanings.sent1: She was fascinated by the homotaxis of the crystals under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The homotaxis of the cells in the organism indicated a healthy state.
meanings.sent3: The homotaxis of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: His room reflected perfect homotaxis, with everything in its place.
meanings.sent5: The homotaxis of the colors in the painting created a soothing effect.
